Sec. 11A-24.1. Civil Fines.
At the conclusion of a hearing and upon a finding of public accommodations discrimination, the Board may consider fines without cost to the complainant. The Board may impose the following fines:
Up to then thousand dollars ($10,000.00) if the respondent has not previously been found guilty of a violation of this article;
Up to twenty-five thousand dollars ($25,000.00) if the respondent has been found guilty of one (1) prior violation of this article within the preceding five (5) years prior to filing of a complaint;
Up to fifty thousand dollars ($50,000.00) if the respondent has been found guilty of two (2) or more violations of this article within the preceding seven (7) years prior to filing of a complaint.
In imposing a fine under this section, the Board shall consider the nature and circumstances of the violation, the degree of culpability, the history of prior violations of this article, the financial circumstances of the respondent and the goal of deterring future violations of this article.
All fines pursuant to this article shall be paid to the Board of County Commissioners.
